description.narrative: "Transport corridors in West Africa. ""Through this project a regional collective agreement is negotiated for West African transport sector, covering all important transport corridors and the minimum terms and conditions of employment. The road transport s ector has grown rapidly over the last few years due to economic globalisation in West Africa. Privatisation, deregulation and outsourcing have fragmented the company structures in the sector. This causes a rapid change in the employment contracts towards p recarious employment such as temporary and short-term employment. For the employees in the sector this means a weakening in terms and conditions of employment, living standards and occupational safety as well as an increasingly hostile and anti-trade union ism environment among employers. When lobbying becomes challenging the number of members decreases, which in turn leads to trade unions losing their influence in society. The project aims at strengthening trade unions? collective bargaining and thereby imp roving the terms and conditions of employment. After the first phase of the project West African transport sector trade unions have negotiated regional collective agreements covering the minimum terms and conditions of employment in all the countries and a re monitoring the implementation of the agreements. Furthermore, the recruitment and membership services have become more effective and the knowledge on interest representation has increased at workplaces (border, bus stops and truck rest stops). Beneficia ries of this project are organisers, negotiators, officers and activists of the local trade unions. The rank and file members benefit from the project in the form of better terms and condition of employment. The project is implemented by transport sector g lobal union International Transport Workers? Federation ITF."" "
